I guess I'd be more impressed with this speech if it weren't over blocking a bill that costs a projected $16 billion a year yet delivers $550 billion for climate change, $400 billion for child care and pre-K, $150 billion for affordable housing, and $150 billion for home-care. Savings on govt spending on scripts/drugs? The "very wide-ranging" deal includes a pledge to extend free school meals to all primary school pupils.

The Build Back Better Act will permanently improve Medicaid coverage for home care services for seniors and people with disabilities, making the most transformative investment in access to home care in 40 years. It will free parents from the crushing cost of preschool and child care so they can go back to work and put that money towards food, rent, and other needs. #BuildBackBetter means expanding access to early childhood education, making childcare more affordable, strengthening long-term care for nearly a million Americans on HCBS waitlists, & expanding child tax cuts for families. This is a starting point towards a long-term care system centered on providing care instead of generating profits.
